title: NASA acknowledges possibility of short-term post-ISS gap
summary: While NASA seeks to maintain an uninterrupted human presence in low Earth orbit, an agency official said a short-term gap between the International Space Station and commercial successors would not be “the end of the world.”

title: The UK to Contribute More Than £3M to the Atlantic Constellation
summary:
The United Kingdom has announced plans to join the Atlantic Constellation partnership, committing more than £3 million to build a pathfinder satellite. In September, Spain signed an agreement with the European Space Agency for the contracting and technical management of the Constelación Atlántica (Atlantic Constellation). The aim of the constellation is to provide data that […]

title: Satellogic gets NOAA license for move to the United States
summary: Satellogic has received a remote sensing license in the United States, the Earth observation operator announced Nov. 21 as it moves operations to the country from Uruguay in search of more government business.

title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX on pace to hit 100 launches in 2023, Soyuz to launch Bars-M
summary: Following a busy week for SpaceX with the launch of two Starlink missions and the second launch of Starship, SpaceX is currently on track to meet its 100 launch goal of 2023. The first launch of the week will be on Tuesday, with a Falcon 9 placing 23 Starlink satellites into low-Earth orbit (LEO). On Thursday, ExPace is expected to launch an unknown payload on its Kuaizhou 1A rocket, followed shortly by Roscosmos launching a Bars-M payload on a Soyuz 2.1a.

title: As military weather satellites near end of life, DoD turns to partners for data
summary: The U.S. Space Force is on track to launch at least two weather monitoring spacecraft next year while determining a long-term replacement for its aging satellites
